intro: Whitfordiodendron atropurpureum, commonly known as the purple-flowered bellwort, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. The species is part of the genus Whitfordiodendron, which is closely related to the genus Tradescantia.
